sections.description: Questions about your organization's capabilities related to monitoring and detection on end-user endpoints and servers.

questions.question_text: Do you collect and monitor process creation events?
questions.help_text: Includes logging when applications, scripts, or commands are executed on endpoints.
questions.detection_impact: Critical for detecting malicious code execution and living-off-the-land techniques.

questions.question_text: Do you capture command-line arguments for executed processes?
questions.help_text: Provides full command visibility, used for detecting obfuscated or suspicious commands.
questions.detection_impact: Essential for detecting script-based attacks and PowerShell misuse.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor Windows Registry modifications?
questions.help_text: Detects persistence mechanisms and configuration changes.
questions.detection_impact: Key for catching privilege escalations and defense evasion.

questions.question_text: Do you track file creation, modification, and deletion events?
questions.help_text: Allows detection of ransomware activity, data staging, or exfiltration.
questions.detection_impact: Critical for malware deployment and suspicious file manipulations.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor scheduled task/job creation and modification?
questions.help_text: Detects persistence via scheduled jobs/tasks.
questions.detection_impact: Common persistence and privilege escalation detection.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor Windows service installations and modifications?
questions.help_text: Detects new or modified services.
questions.detection_impact: Critical for persistence and privilege escalation detection.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor DLL loading activities?
questions.help_text: Detects DLL injection, hijacking, and side-loading attacks.
questions.detection_impact: Detects malicious code injection.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor driver installations and loading?
questions.help_text: Detects kernel driver loading and modifications.
questions.detection_impact: Critical for detecting rootkits and advanced malware.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation) activity?
questions.help_text: Detects living-off-the-land and lateral movement.
questions.detection_impact: Enables detection of fileless and stealthy behaviors.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor PowerShell execution and script block logging?
questions.help_text: Capture detailed PowerShell activity including script contents.
questions.detection_impact: Essential for modern attack detectionâ€”PowerShell is heavily used in attacks.

sections.description: Questions about your network and cloud visibility and monitoring capabilities.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor DNS queries from your endpoints?
questions.help_text: Enables detection of command and control and domain generation algorithms.
questions.detection_impact: Essential for blocking malicious connections.

questions.question_text: Do you log network connections (origin/destination IP, port, protocol)?
questions.help_text: Critical for lateral movement and exfiltration detection.
questions.detection_impact: Detect suspicious internal and external traffic.

questions.question_text: Do you perform deep packet inspection or full packet capture?
questions.help_text: Inspect actual content of network traffic for advanced threat detection.
questions.detection_impact: Crucial for responding to data exfiltration and malware transmission.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor web proxy logs and HTTP/HTTPS traffic?
questions.help_text: View web browsing and HTTP request activity.
questions.detection_impact: Detects malicious downloads and web attack vectors.

sections.description: Questions concerning authentication, authorization, and privileged account use.

questions.question_text: Do you log all authentication attempts (success and failure)?
questions.help_text: Monitor who logs on and failed attempts for every system.
questions.detection_impact: Detects brute force and credential stuffing.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor privileged account usage (admin, root, service accounts)?
questions.help_text: Monitors sensitive account activity and escalation.
questions.detection_impact: Critical for privilege escalation and insider threat monitoring.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor user account creation, modification, and deletion?
questions.help_text: Detects rogue accounts and abnormal modifications.
questions.detection_impact: Key for detecting persistence and policy violations.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor group membership changes for privileged groups?
questions.help_text: Detects when users are added to Admin or sensitive groups.
questions.detection_impact: Prevents privilege escalation and insider threat.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor Kerberos ticket requests and authentication?
questions.help_text: Critical for detecting 'Pass-the-Ticket', Golden Ticket, Kerberoasting.
questions.detection_impact: Key for detecting advanced Active Directory attacks.

sections.description: Questions about monitoring cloud and SaaS environments like AWS, Azure, GCP.

questions.question_text: Do you collect and monitor cloud API logs (CloudTrail, Azure Activity, GCP Audit)?
questions.help_text: See API calls made to cloud infrastructure.
questions.detection_impact: Critical for cloud posture, detecting malicious changes and privilege escalation.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor cloud storage access (S3, Blob Storage, Cloud Storage)?
questions.help_text: Track who accesses cloud buckets/objects.
questions.detection_impact: Detects data breaches and unauthorized data access.

questions.question_text: Do you monitor cloud compute instance creation and modification?
questions.help_text: Detect VM/container deployments.
questions.detection_impact: Detects unauthorized workloads and crypto mining.

coverage_levels.0: No Monitoring - No capability or collection
coverage_levels.2: Basic - Majority of systems, some gaps
coverage_levels.3: Moderate - Good coverage for most systems
coverage_levels.5: Full - Automated, complete, across all environments
